intro: Morinda citrina var. chlorina, commonly known as the yellow morinda, is a variant of the morinda plant characterized by its distinct yellow foliage. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Asia. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and emit a mild fragrance. The flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
